column4: I don't even a command line, so I'm not sure how that could help
even have*
One HD, one partition
hmm wait
i think the HD may be set to slave
nothing i known, restored, barely working PC
but im not 100% sure
Well my problem (right now) is that when i boot into my newly installed Ubuntu Server, I get "[   0.530002] Kernel panic - not syncing: VPS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown-block(0,0)"
the 0.xxxxx
Can anyone else please help me then?
go ahead and ask your question
any ideas?
I personally don't know, but it's good practice to ask every few minutes and someone will jump in if they're familiar
can you boot from a CD or USB and fsck that drive?
i can boot from a cd, but i will need guidance in fsck'ing
sure, I have to run in a few, but I'm sure there'd be someone here that can definitely help you do that.
If you know the drive, (/dev/sdX) it's as easy as opening a terminal when you boot from a CD/USB and run 'fsck /dev/sdX' in the terminal
you're going to need to 'gksudo gedit /etc/defaults/grub' to open it as root
Are you...on a server?
then...nano is pretty easy: sudo nano /etc/defauts/grub
says it's a new file
uh. maybe it's /etc/default/grub then, sorry
